New Records: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 33 points and 11 rebounds, leading the Thunder to their franchise-record 15th straight win.
Key Match Events: Boston rallied and led 65-55 at halftime.
The Thunder trimmed the deficit to 80-76 at the end of the third quarter and regained the lead, 81-80, on a pair of free throws by Jalen Williams early in the fourth.
Back-to-back 3s by Lu Dort put the Thunder up 100-88 with just under two minutes to play.
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder, much like it did Friday against New York, refused to cave when it fell behind by double digits. The Thunder hung around, then outscored the Celtics 29-12 in the fourth quarter.
Oklahoma City, much like it did Friday against New York, refused to cave when it fell behind by double digits. The Thunder hung around, then outscored the Celtics 29-12 in the fourth quarter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Isaiah Hartenstein booms on Derrick White with a thunderous alley-oop flush.
